name: elastic_amcache_application
description: Installed applications from Windows Amcache registry

columns.name: program_instance_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the program instance

columns.name: registry_key_path
columns.description: Registry key path where application is registered

columns.name: inbox_modern_app
columns.description: Whether application is a modern (UWP) app

columns.name: user_sid
columns.description: User SID if application is user-specific

name: elastic_amcache_application_file
description: Inventory of application files from Windows Amcache (Root\\InventoryApplicationFile)

columns.name: is_os_component
columns.description: Whether the file is an OS component

name: elastic_amcache_application_shortcut
description: Inventory of application shortcuts from Windows Amcache (Root\\InventoryApplicationShortcut)

name: elastic_amcache_applications_view
description: Combined view of Amcache applications and application files

columns.name: is_os_component
columns.description: Whether the file is an OS component

columns.name: registry_key_path
columns.description: Registry key path where application is registered

columns.name: inbox_modern_app
columns.description: Whether application is a modern (UWP) app

columns.name: user_sid
columns.description: User SID if application is user-specific

name: elastic_amcache_device_pnp
description: Plug and Play device inventory from Windows Amcache (Root\\InventoryDevicePnp)

name: elastic_amcache_driver_binary
description: Driver binary metadata from Windows Amcache

name: elastic_amcache_driver_package
description: Driver package inventory from Windows Amcache (Root\\InventoryDriverPackage)

columns.name: is_active
columns.description: Whether the driver package is active

name: elastic_browser_history
description: Browser history from Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, and Brave

columns.name: url_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the URL in the browser's database

columns.name: browser
columns.description: Browser name (chrome, firefox, safari, edge, brave)

columns.name: transition_type
columns.description: How the visit occurred (link, typed, auto_bookmark, etc.)

columns.name: referring_url
columns.description: URL that referred to this page

columns.name: from_visit_id
columns.description: Visit ID of the referring visit

columns.name: history_path
columns.description: Path to the browser history database file

columns.name: ch_visit_duration_ms
columns.description: Visit duration in milliseconds (Chromium browsers only)

columns.name: sf_load_successful
columns.description: Whether page loaded successfully in Safari (1=yes, 0=no)

name: elastic_file_analysis
description: File analysis including code signing, dependencies, symbols, and strings (macOS only)

columns.name: path
columns.description: Full path to the file being analyzed

columns.name: strings
columns.description: Printable strings from the file (output from 'strings')

name: host_groups
description: Local system groups (from /etc/group on Unix systems)

name: host_processes
description: All running processes on the host

columns.name: on_disk
columns.description: Whether binary still exists on disk (1=yes, 0=no)

name: host_users
description: Local user accounts (from /etc/passwd on Unix systems)

columns.name: description
columns.description: Optional user description or full name (GECOS field)
